title.native: 池袋ウエストゲートパーク

description:
Based on a series of urban mystery novels.

Crime-ridden Ikebukuro is a haven for violent gangs, the Yakuza, and home to Makoto Majima. To protect his friends, this charismatic troubleshooter mediates disputes among the warring factions—even fixing problems the police can’t. But when a rising tide of violence results in Makoto losing a loved one, can he ride out the storm, or will he drown in all the spilled blood that floods his streets?

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

title.native: 池袋ウエストゲートパーク

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/koshiaki09)

Formerly affiliated with [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/), currently affiliated with [Studio Kafka](https://anilist.co/studio/6754/Studio-Kafka).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1038952624)

Currently affiliated with [Yostar Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6371/Yostar-Pictures). Previously affiliated with [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/).

__[Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/takada.html)__

__Ryuuichi Takada__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and member of music unit MONACA. He mainly composes and arranges for videogames, having worked on the soundtracks for Soul Calibur, Tekken, Katamari Damacy, and The iDOLM@STER.

**[Official Site](https://daijironakagawa.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/daijirooo7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/daijirooo7/)**

Guitarist and composer for the band [JYOCHO](https://anilist.co/staff/140346). Also works as a freelance/solo artist.

__[Website](http://thepinballs.org/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/PINS_official) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/thepinballs) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE_zZ1mX8I0IvPKVaHHzbwQ)__

__Formed:__ 2006

__Introduction:__
The Pinballs, alternatively known as PINS, is a four-piece Japanese rock band from Saitama Prefecture, who are under record labels No Big Deal Records and Nippon Columbia (Dec 2017–). Their music is influenced by other Japanese rock bands, such as THEE MICHELLE GUN ELEPHANT and BLANKEY JET CITY, while also harboring roots in music brought about during the "British Invasion", from artist like The Who and The Rolling Stones.

__Members:__
- Takayuki Furukawa (古川貴之, フルカワタカユキ) – vocalist, guitarist
- Tomohiro Nakaya (中屋智裕, ナカヤトモヒロ) – guitarist
- Hirotaka Morishita(森下拓貴, モリシタヒロタカ) – bassist
- Takashi Ishihara (石原天, イシハラタカシ) – drummer

name.native: イノセント・イン・フォーマル

Alexander Porfiryevich Borodin was a Russian chemist and Romantic musical composer of Georgian ancestry. He was one of the prominent 19th-century composers known as "The Mighty Handful", a group dedicated to producing a uniquely Russian kind of classical music, rather than imitating earlier Western European models. Borodin is known best for his symphonies, his two string quartets, the symphonic poem In the Steppes of Central Asia and his opera Prince Igor.
